intro: Roupala gardneri var. dentata, commonly known as the serrated roupala, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves with serrated margins. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland tropical forests. Its unique morphology and habitat make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
